name: Dune and Estuary Walk, Portstewart Strand

ai.summary: A challenging 15.2 km coastal hike blending sea dune scenery with estuary views along Portstewart Strand. The route is strenuous, with varied surfaces and variable coastal weather, offering wide horizons and dramatic landscapes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mix of firm coastal paths, long sections of soft dune sand, grassy bank viewpoints, and tidal estuary banks. Expect uneven footing, dune ridges, loose sand, and occasional beach crossings that depend on tides.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around tides and weather; stay on marked paths; avoid unstable dune faces and cliffs; wear sturdy footwear for sand and gravel; bring plenty of water and high-energy snacks; dress in layers with a windproof/waterproof jacket; use sun protection; check the forecast for coastal winds; carry a map or GPS and keep a charged phone; inform someone of your route and expected return time; turn back if conditions worsen or if tide blocks the route.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good traction
Layered clothing plus a windproof/waterproof jacket
Map, compass or GPS device (and a charged phone)
Snacks and energy bars for the 15.2 km hike
Compact emergency blanket or insulating layer
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal; summer offers the longest days but coastal winds can be strong. Be prepared for changing conditions year-round.

seo.meta_description: Conquer the 15.2 km Dune and Estuary Walk at Portstewart Strand in the UK. A challenging coastal hike through dunes and estuary scenery with wind and tide considerations.
